questions.question: The plane wave propagating through the dielectric has the magnetic field component as H = 20e⁻ᵃˣcos(ωt - 0.25x) a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA7> A/m (aₓ, a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA7>, a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA₂) are unit vectors along x, y and z axis respectively). Determine the polarization of the wave

In free space, H = 0.1 cos(ωt - βx) a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA₂> A/m (aₓ, a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA7>, a<0xE1><0xB5><0xA₂) are unit vectors along x, y and z axis respectively). The total power passing through a square plate of side 10 cm on plane x + 2y = 1.0 is approximately:
Consider the rectangular cavity as shown below:  If a = c > b, the dominant mode of resonance corresponding to the above rectangular cavity is
A video camera generates data at a rate of 5 Mbps. The data is channel coded at rate 1/3 and 8 PSK modulated. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: Information rate: 15 Mbps; Symbol rate: 5 Msps
Information rate: 5 Mbps; Symbol rate: 5 Msps
Information rate: 15 Mbps; Symbol rate: 15 Msps
Information rate: 5 Mbps; Symbol rate: 15 Msps
questions.answer: Information rate: 15 Mbps; Symbol rate: 5 Msps

questions.question: Evaluate ∫[-∞ to ∞] x⁴f(x)dx, where, f(x) = (1/√2π)e^(-x²/2), x ∈ (-∞, ∞)

Consider a transformation T: R³ → R² where R³ and R² represent three and two dimensional real column vectors respectively. Also, T(x) = Ax for some matrix A and for each x in R³. How many rows and columns does A have and what is the its maximum possible rank?

The output of a three element co-linear antenna array operating in a free space environment is combined (after appropriate phase shifting) to maximize the signal received from a particular direction as shown in figure.  If the inter-element spacing is half of the signal wavelength and direction of maximum response is 30° from the perpendicular to the array, what are the phases to be applied to each element? Consider the first element as the reference.

The transmission line of characteristic impedance 50 Ω and feeding a purely resistive load of 200 Ω uses single quarter wavelength long short-circuit stub which is placed at a distance d from the load. The VSWR on the transmission line section of length d and VSWR on the stub respectively are
The plane Y=0 carries a uniform current density of -20k̂ mA/m. The magnetic field intensity at X=1, Y=10 and Z=-2 is
A charge of 2 Coulombs is placed near a grounded conducting plate at a distance of 1 m. The force acting between the charge of 2 C and ground conducting plate in Newton is
A data sequence x[n] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} passes through a linear time-invariant system with impulse response h[n] = {5, 4, 3, 2, 1}. The output of the filter will be
Consider a signal v(t) with Fourier transform V(f). If V'(t) represents the Fourier transform of v(2t), what is the relation of V'(f) to V(f)?
options: Magnitude scaled by 0.5 and bandwidth compressed
Magnitude scaled by 0.5 and bandwidth expanded
Magnitude scaled by 2 and bandwidth compressed
Magnitude scaled by 2 and bandwidth expanded
questions.answer: Magnitude scaled by 0.5 and bandwidth expanded

questions.question: If one of the code words of a Hamming (7, 4) code is 0001011, which of the following cannot be the valid code word in the same group?
Which of the following digital modulations can be decoded non-coherently?

A mobile antenna receives two copies of the signal transmitted by the base station. The first copy is the line-of-sight component and the other is a reflected component which is 20 dB weaker in terms of Power than the LoS component and delayed by 100 ns. If the signal is sufficiently wideband, causing constructive and destructive interference at different frequency points within the signal bandwidth. What will be the ratio of maximum to minimum signal level variation across bandwidth and what will be the frequency separation between two consecutive maxima or minima?

An antenna with an efficiency of 90% has a maximum radiation intensity of 0.5 W/Steradian. Calculate the directive gain of the antenna when the input power to the antenna when the input power to the antenna is 0.4 W

In a semiconductor device, if Fermi level (E<0xE1><0xB5><0x9F>) is positioned at conduction band (E<0xE1><0xB5><0x88>). Determine the approximate probability of finding electrons in states at (E<0xE1><0xB5><0x88> + kT) (where k is Boltzmann constant and T is device temperature in Kelvin).

A radar receiver has a detection SNR threshold of 10 dB for a 4 MHz bandwidth signal at 300 MHz frequency. If the transmit EIRP of the radar is 40 dBW and receive G/T is 10 dB/K, what is the maximum Radar cross-section (in dB-meter square) detectable at 10 km range? (Given: 10 log(4π) = 11, 10 log(k) = -228.6, k is Boltzmann constant).

A source generates four messages m1, m2, m3 and m4 with probabilities 0.5, 0.25, 0.125 and 0.125 respectively. The messages are generated independently of each other. A source coder assigns binary code to each message. Which of the following codes has minimum average length is also uniquely decodable (sequence as per m1, m2, m3, m4)?

If V<0xE1><0xB5><0xA2><0xE2><0x82><0x99> = 1.2 V find the minimum value of aspect ratio of M₂ transistor to remain saturated. (√10 = 3.16)

Two coherent microwave power sources of same frequency f, each generating P Watts of average power, are combined using a four port network in the following manner:  If the S-parameter of 4-port network are [S-matrix values], what should be the phase difference between the inputs to maximize the output at port 2 and what is the maximum power?
Which of the following statement is wrong?
Which of the following statement is correct?
options: NAND and NOR functions are Commutative and Associated
Both NAND and NOR functions are neither Commutative nor Associative
NAND and NOR functions are Associative but Commutative
NAND and NOR functions are Commutative but not Associative
questions.answer: NAND and NOR functions are Commutative but not Associative

In a p-type Si at 300 K and N<0xE2><0x82><0x90> = 8 × 10¹⁵ cm⁻³, variation of space-charge density in the semiconductor as a function of surface potential is plotted, then select the true statement for weak inversion region. Given that p<0xE2><0x82><0x9B> and n<0xE2><0x82><0x9B> are hole and electron concentrations at the surface.
In order to ensure that the output voltage of an op-amp is zero, when both its inputs are grounded
options: an external offset balancing circuit is used at the input terminals
the currents incident at the output node are carefully designed
the totem-pole output transistors are designed to have exactly equal cut-in voltages
questions.answer: an external offset balancing circuit is used at the input terminals

(Given: Effective density state N<0xE1><0xB5><0x88> = 2.7 × 10¹⁹ cm⁻³ and Thermal Voltage (V<0xE1><0xB5><0x80>) at 300K is 26 mV)

If a slab of dielectric constant √3 is inserted in between the plates such that the normal to the boundary makes an angle 45° with the lines of electric force in between the plates. Find the angle (θ) between the electric lines in the medium between the plates (vacuum) and dielectric slab.

D. The negative gate current turns off the Thyristor.

Consider two control systems with following transfer function,
System 1: G(s) = 1/(3s + 1)
System 2: G(s) = 1/(s + 1)
Which of the following is true?
options: Bandwidth of System 1 is greater than bandwidth of System 2
Bandwidth of System 2 is greater than bandwidth of System 1
Bandwidth of both the systems is same
questions.answer: Bandwidth of System 2 is greater than bandwidth of System 1
